message.content:
cs.MA, cs.RO, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of coordinating a set of autonomous mobile robots, which is a common topic in multi-agent systems (MAS) research. The paper specifically focuses on the tasks of leader election and pattern formation, which are fundamental problems in MAS. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.MA (Multiagent Systems). The paper also involves the study of the robots' behavior and their ability to communicate and remember, which falls under the sub-categories of cs.RO (Robotics) and cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper also proposes a model for the robots' behavior, which can be considered as a form of artificial intelligence, hence cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the influence of chirality on the robots' behavior, which can be seen as a form of control theory, hence cs.SY (Systems and Control) is also a possible sub-category.
